com.esri.mo2.map.img
Interface ImageWriter

All Known Implementing Classes:
BMPImageWriter, JPEGImageWriter, PNGImageWriter
public interface ImageWriter

Writes an image to an output stream. Implementations of this interface will write the image in a particular format.

The example:


 ImageWriter imageWriter = new JPEGImageWriter();
 String[] list = imageWriter.getListOfExtension();
 for( int i = 0; i < list.length; i++ ) {
   System.out.println("support extension : " + list[i]);
 }
 String description = imageWriter.getDescription();
 System.out.println("description=" + description);
 imageWriter.setAttribute("Quality", "0.7"); // set specific JPEG compression rate
 OutputStream outputStream = new FileOutputStream(new File("/temp/output.jpeg));
 imageWriter.exportImage(outputStream, image);

Image writer classes are organized in PlugIns. Use class ImageSupport to find which PlugIns are presented in the system.

See Also:
ImageSupport

Method Detail

createInstance

public ImageWriter createInstance()
Create the instance of ImageWriter.

Returns:
the instance of ImageWriter.

exportImage

public void exportImage(OutputStream os,
                        BufferedImage image)
writes the given BufferedImage to the given OutputStream

Parameters:
os - output stream
image - BufferedImage

getListOfExtension

public String[] getListOfExtension()
Returns:
a list of the name of formats that this ImageExporter writes. Typically, these names will be displayed in a user interface if the ImageProvider can't support any formats then the result will be empty list

getDescription

public String getDescription()
Returns:
the description of the image format. Typically, these description will be displayed in a user interface

setAttribute

public void setAttribute(String key,
                         String value)
The method sets various attributes that can be applied when the image will produce. These attributes depend from specific ImagaWriter implementation. If the attribute was not specified the default value will be accepted.

Parameters:
key - is the attribute name string
value - is the value name string

getListAttributes

public Hashtable getListAttributes()
The method returns the list of the attributes and values.

Returns:
a pairs of the of the attributes and their values.
